chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Greg E. Beluch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution shall be paid at a minimum rate of $200.00 per month.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Greg E. Beluch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Greg E. Beluch in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend count 1 to issuance of worthless check - 943.24(1).  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to the amended charge.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence - probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution in the amount of $2,510.50 plus restitution surcharge at a minimum rate of $200.00 a month; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Greg E. Beluch in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Defendant is waiving time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.  - rt
